availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Marshall County, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Married to Emily Courtney Noel Burradell. Father of Franklin N. Burradell and Sarah C. Burradell. Enslaved nine people in 1860, including six males (ages 50, 45, 30, 9, 5, and 3 years) and three females (ages 40, 30, and 7 years).

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2, stamped p. 359. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, unknown district, p. 159. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, unknown district, p. 5. Kentucky Birth, Marriage, and Death Records, 1783-1965, Ancestry, Marriages, Trigg County, 1824. Find A Grave, "John L. Burradell (1803-1885)," Memorial #31216166, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=31216166&ref=acom (accessed 14 June 2016).
